TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
By the way, Wolf Aerospace has pretty good Soyuz and Apollo like LES parts, both for 1.25m and 2.5m pods. I always used them with procedural fairing (as a boost protective cover).

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/37138-0-24-2-Wolf-Aerospace-Perfectrons-L-E-S-Pack-11-08-2014

Progress is launched without an LES...

Hmm, it says here that Progress with LES were used for trials of Buran ejection seats.
Okay so early Progress launches when they didn't want to bother with unproven aerodynamics. But today's Progress are launched with no LES because it's a waste of time and resources.

A bit of deliberation I'm having is where to house the experiment modules... (Actually suggestions on this would be really helpful!)

New experiments could be intriguing. I did plan some for more MIR stuff.

Excellent news

Well the "native" station science modules are not terrible, but what seems obvious solutions for Soviet crafts:

1. Progress capsules - these can either be perishable (no return), as you can mostly extract the experiments and load them into manned capsules for reentry, or you can recover the entire capsule (which is unprogresslike, but hey), or you could develop something like the Raduga (how, I'm not sure, and I'm not sure it's worth the effort)

2. TKS modules - just a "cargo module" loaded with the experiment. You could base this one off the current cargo module (in fact a "native" experiment capsule fits just snugly inside as is), just fill the inside with some gubbins that would look experiment-like. Manual extraction before reentry would be required, of course.

As to the new experiments - why not start off the MIR experiments themselves? Kvant-2 had a quail-hatching experiment, that sounds pretty much like the kibbal ones in SS. Kristall - material processing (a new experiment branch?) or electric-related stuff (like the quarks or whatever in SS). Spektr seems to be focused on Earth research, so it should have some sort of experiment for analysing the parent body it is orbiting. Priroda also focused on the Earth, so it could be a complement/expansion to Spektr.

Of course, there could be more than just this - a bigger Eureka generator than the Kvant-1, and alternatives for the other modules from SS... then one would want to build something like this

Edited September 19, 2014 by TheBedla

Excellent news

Well the "native" station science modules are not terrible, but what seems obvious solutions for Soviet crafts:

1. Progress capsules - these can either be perishable (no return), as you can mostly extract the experiments and load them into manned capsules for reentry, or you can recover the entire capsule (which is unprogresslike, but hey), or you could develop something like the Raduga (how, I'm not sure, and I'm not sure it's worth the effort)

2. TKS modules - just a "cargo module" loaded with the experiment. You could base this one off the current cargo module (in fact a "native" experiment capsule fits just snugly inside as is), just fill the inside with some gubbins that would look experiment-like. Manual extraction before reentry would be required, of course.

As to the new experiments - why not start off the MIR experiments themselves? Kvant-2 had a quail-hatching experiment, that sounds pretty much like the kibbal ones in SS. Kristall - material processing (a new experiment branch?) or electric-related stuff (like the quarks or whatever in SS). Spektr seems to be focused on Earth research, so it should have some sort of experiment for analysing the parent body it is orbiting. Priroda also focused on the Earth, so it could be a complement/expansion to Spektr.

Of course, there could be more than just this - a bigger Eureka generator than the Kvant-1, and alternatives for the other modules from SS... then one would want to build something like this

http://wiki.alternatehistory.com/lib/exe/fetch.php/timelines/mir-ghost.jpg

A TKS-like module is tempting

I think your idea of repeating the MIR experiments is pretty solid and it was brought up before. That could be done!

Still need more Mir Parts though, I suppose.

Also, Niemand303's video seems to have disappeared, but it was some stellar work! Really awesome use of the new camera plugin.

Anyway...

Here is the stage II engine for the Proton.

Not quite done yet, but its shaping up fairly well.

Based on Ste1701's screenshots from orbiter, thanks for the help!

It's 800 Polygons, probably the highest number I've ever used

Perhaps the Proton could support the Soyuz and Progress spacecraft? Also, will the Proton have a third stage like the irl Proton does?

Yeah For the first release at least, it will be Proton only. Of course people can use other mod packs for their Soyuz rocket!

The Proton will have a third stage, yes

Nice 2nd stage!

By the way: what you have on these screenshots is a first version of Proton (UR-500) - rated as 8 tons to LEO. Next versions (Proton-K and Proton-M) were 3-stage rockets.
